name: Caban
description: former school--a restaurant and art community now

name: Castell Caernarfon Castle
description: Welsh castle that was taken over--in 900s?-- by the English; the Castle Charles was crowned Prince of Wales

name: Dinorwyg
description: Anglicized spelling and pronunciation: Dinorwyc; slate quarry

name: Penrhyn
description: use an aspirated 'h' and long 'y'; this is famous for one of the longest labor disputes--2yrs

name: Sygun Copper Mine
description: aka Beddgelert Gwyedd: Beddgelert is the twon name and Gwyedd is the county

name: Festiniog
description: Anglecized--this is why there is a single 'f' and not Ffestiniog

name: Port Dinorwyc
description: Anglecized version of Dinorwyg; aka Y Felinheli--literally called 'The Mill' or called 'The Mill on the River Helen'

name: Vaynol Estate
alt: Dinorwyg was owned by the Asshton-Smith family

name: Penrhyn Castle
alt: owners of the Penrhyn Quarry--built in the late 19th cent.

name: Portmeirion Village and Gardens
description: built in the 1920s-ish to be a resort town
